insight: Transfers are usually instant. Bonus promotions can occasionally increase the ratio.
terms: All transfers are final and cannot be reversed.
The name on both loyalty accounts must match exactly to complete the transfer.
Aeroplan miles expire after 18 months of inactivity unless you earn, redeem, or transfer in more miles.

insight: Allow up to 48 hours. A 5,000-point bonus is added for every 60,000 points transferred.
terms: Transfers typically post within two days but can take longer during promotions.
You must transfer in increments of 1,000 Membership Rewards points.
Once points reach Marriott Bonvoy they follow the program's 24-month activity expiration policy.

insight: Transfers are instant. Redemptions start at 3,500 points for off-peak Category 1 hotels.
terms: Only primary cardholders can initiate transfers to World of Hyatt.
Hyatt accounts must be open and in good standing prior to the transfer.
Hyatt points do not expire with at least one earning or redeeming activity every 24 months.

insight: Transfers are instant, but you cannot transfer United miles back to Chase once complete.
terms: MileagePlus accounts must belong to you or an authorized user on the credit card.
United miles never expire, but award space is subject to capacity controls.
Changes and cancellations follow United's award ticket fee structure.

insight: Transfers post within 24 hours. LifeMiles regularly discounts award bookings by 10–15%.
terms: LifeMiles transfers must be made in 1,000-point increments.
Purchased, pooled, or transferred-in LifeMiles follow the program's standard expiration rules.
Award tickets booked with LifeMiles are subject to partner carrier taxes and surcharges.

insight: Expect 1–2 day processing. Watch for seasonal promotions on all-inclusive partner resorts.
terms: Choice Privileges requires a minimum transfer of 1,000 ThankYou points.
Transferred points expire according to Choice's standard terms, typically two years from the deposit date.
Award availability varies by property and can be capacity-controlled during peak periods.

from: Axis Bank Burgundy Private & Magnus (Burgundy) Credit Cards
insight: Premium Burgundy cardholders enjoy the best conversion rate across all Axis Bank transfer partners.
terms: Ratios apply to all current Axis Bank airline and hotel transfer partners.
Transfers are irreversible once initiated and follow the partner program's expiry rules.
The primary cardholder name must match the receiving loyalty account.

from: Axis Bank Reserve & Magnus Credit Cards
insight: High-end Reserve and Magnus cardholders receive an elevated 2-for-5 transfer ratio to any partner.
terms: Ratios apply uniformly to all Axis Bank transfer partners.
Transferred points follow the destination program's expiration policies.
Allow up to 24 hours for the transfer to reflect, depending on the partner.

insight: Horizon cardholders enjoy a simple one-to-one conversion to any partner program.
terms: All transfers must be made in whole EDGE Mile increments.
Partner-specific minimums may apply at the time of transfer.
Processing times vary by partner and can take up to two business days.

from: IndianOil Axis Bank Premium Credit Card
insight: Convert earned fuel rewards into travel by transferring EDGE Miles to participating partners.
terms: A minimum of 200 EDGE Miles per transfer may be required by Axis Bank.
Partner program terms govern point expiration once miles are transferred.
Name and account details must align between Axis Bank and partner accounts.

insight: Olympus cardholders receive an exceptional 4x partner conversion on every EDGE Mile transferred.
terms: Enhanced ratios are available across all Axis Bank transfer partners.
Once converted, partner points cannot be moved back to Axis Bank.
Expect transfers to complete within one business day for most partners.

insight: Atlas cardholders can double their points value when moving EDGE Miles to most airline and hotel partners.
terms: Standard 1:2 transfers exclude Marriott Bonvoy, which follows a dedicated ratio.
Transfers are final and governed by the partner program's expiration rules.
Allow up to 48 hours for the transfer to appear in the partner account.

insight: Marriott conversions from Atlas cards follow a reduced ratio compared with other partners.
terms: Transfers must be completed in increments supported by Marriott Bonvoy.
Once received, Marriott Bonvoy points observe the program's 24-month activity rule.
Processing can take up to three business days.

from: Axis Bank SSelect, Privilege & Rewards Credit Cards
insight: Mid-tier cardholders get improved value when transferring to Vistara, ITC, SpiceJet, or airasia.
terms: Only the listed partners qualify for the 5:1 conversion rate.
Other partners default to the standard SSelect conversion ratio.
Ensure partner accounts are active before initiating a transfer.

from: Axis Bank SSelect, Privilege & Rewards Credit Cards
insight: For partners outside the preferred list, SSelect, Privilege, and Rewards cards convert at a 10:1 ratio.
terms: Applies to all remaining airline and hotel partners in the Axis Bank catalog.
Transferred points follow the partner program's expiration schedule.
Processing timelines depend on the destination program.

from: Axis Bank Other Eligible Credit Cards
insight: Entry-level cards still unlock a 10:1 ratio for key airline and hotel partners.
terms: Only transfers to Vistara, ITC, SpiceJet, and airasia qualify for this rate.
Transfers may take up to three business days to reflect.
Ensure the recipient program account is in good standing before transferring.

from: Axis Bank Other Eligible Credit Cards
insight: All remaining partners convert at the base 20:1 ratio for standard Axis Bank cards.
terms: This conversion applies to any partner not explicitly listed for a higher ratio.
Transferred points cannot be reversed once submitted.
Expect processing to take between one and three business days.
